text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The candidate answer explicitly notes that Belgian officers were acting in accordance with Article 9(5) of the Convention when they approached the vessel to request information. Specifically, it states: 'Under Art. 9(4)-(5), they may \"enquire and report on infringements,\" \"identify the vessel, seek to obtain the necessary information from the vessel and report.\" For serious matters, they may order the vessel to stop or board to verify facts (Art. 9(5)-(6)), but not while fishing except in emergencies (Art. 9(7)). No such order or boarding occurred here\u2014only a request for information upon approach.' This directly addresses and confirms the action taken by the Belgian officers falls under the scope of Article 9(5).", "criterion_id": "criterion 5"}
